intro: Lagenophora huegelii, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are elliptical and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found growing in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cool, moist environments.
